definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

sentences.english: The reporters were banished from the enemy-occupied areas.
sentences.chinese: 记者们被禁止采访敌占区。

sentences.english: Expansion of Guerrilla Warfare and Establishment of Small, Concealed Guerrilla Base Areas in Enemy-Occupied Areas.
sentences.chinese: 发展敌占区的游击战争与创造隐蔽的小块游击根据地。

sentences.english: World War II photos taken in the former USSR during World War II on the occupied territories.
sentences.chinese: 这些照片是二战期间在苏联敌占区拍的。

sentences.english: We are scheming to secretly cross the enemy territory.
sentences.chinese: 我们在秘密商定穿越敌占区的计划。

sentences.english: He often went into enemy-occupied areas to gather information for the Eighth Route Army.
sentences.chinese: 他常常深入敌占区给八路军收集情报。

sentences.english: Our troops have penetrated (into) enemy territory.
sentences.chinese: 我部队已深入到敌占区。

sentences.english: She worked for two years in the enemy-occupied area.
sentences.chinese: 她在敌占区工作了两年。

sentences.english: The flame of resistance never entirely flickered out in the enemy-occupied areas.
sentences.chinese: 在敌占区，反抗的火焰从不曾完全被扑灭。

sentences.english: That was why he dared work in the enemy zone.
sentences.chinese: 这就是他敢于在敌占区工作的原因。

definition: Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
Shanxi 山西, Chahar 察哈爾|察哈尔 and Hebei 河北 (three provinces of the Republic of China in the period 1912-1936)
Liberation city district/Jiefang district of Jiaozuo city 焦作市[Jiao1 zuo4 shi4], Henan
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
old name for district of Hohhot city 呼和浩特[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4], Inner Mongolia
White Guard or White Movement, anti-communist troops fighting against the Bolsheviks during the Russian Civil War (1917-1922)
